summary:
When I get a lot of challenges and I feel like I matter then I am like a fish in water. In my social contact with people describe me as a phlegmatic person and serious in my job. But I don’t skip a joke!
I am not shy of challenges like thinking in innovative ideas, in which I take the present but also futuristic technology in count.

education.field_of_study: Scenario thinking during incidents and crisis
Homeland Security, Law Enforcement, Firefighting and Related Protective Services

awards.title: Best Delegate
awards.description:
The Change the World Model United Nations (CWMUN) is an annual international meetings program attended by more than 5000 students from all over the world, in which they debate the major issues of the international political agenda. CWMUN is the largest international youth Forum on the planet which takes place in different cities: New York City, Abu Dhabi, Singapore and Rome

The experience is designed for young people who want to change the world and improve themselves. Change the World is an opportunity to grow, learn to relate to those who think differently and become citizens of the world. CWMUN is a unique event where students, political leaders, sports champions and geopolitics experts come together to discuss about future, cooperation and sustainability.

I had the honor to be awarded with the 'Best delegate' award during the virtual conference of the CWMUN.
awards.issuer: Change the World Model United Nations

awards.title: Dutch champion Facility supervisor
awards.description:
Thursday 21 March 2019 I was allowed to play the semi-final. I had to act as a facility manager in various assignments such as:
1. Complaint conversation with an employee (actor)
2. Create a work schedule for an employee
3. Provide first aid in an industrial accident
4. Evaluate 2 quotations on furniture and write a recommendation.

For the final on Friday March 22, 2019 I had to make an operational plan for a company. This also included a management report, an action plan and a presentation.

certifications.name: Security & Safety challenges in a globalized world
Terrorism and Counterterrorism: Comparing Theory and Practice
Certificate of Participation 8th International Smart Cities Intensive Programme 2021
certifications.authority: Hogeschool Inholland / Inholland University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Terrorism & Risk analysis
projects.description:
The conflict between Hamas and Israel has been going on in the Gaza Strip for years. With this project I made a risk analysis for the government buildings of Israel in Tel Aviv.
Topics discussed here include:
- What are the capabilities of Hamas?
- What is Hamas' modus operandi?
- What are plausible targets for Hamas?
- What is the vulnerability and resilience of those targets?
- How can Israel protect government buildings in Israel from Hamas attacks?

projects.title: Intensive Project
projects.description:
During this international project I worked as a client and safety expert on software with which we can apply crowd control via the Kalman filter.

Participating Universities:
 Karelia University of Applied Sciences (Joensuu – Finland)
 Universidad Politécnica de Cartagena (Cartagena – Spain)
 InHolland UAS (Rotterdam - The Netherlands)
 Hogeschool Gent (Gent – Aalst - Belgium)

contributors.headline: Software Engineer | Bookworm | Mentally in New York

projects.title: Physical safety
projects.description: During this project, I and my project group evaluated the emergency response during the Bijlmer disaster and the fire at Chemie-Pack. In addition, we underwent a crisis simulation in which I was the leader of the Regional Operational Team.

projects.title: Policy note - Crisis communication Chemie-Pack
projects.description:
During this individual project I analyzed the crisis communication of the municipality of Moerdijk and gave advice about it in 2 pages.

I completed this project with an 8.2.

projects.title: Drug smuggle through the Port of Rotterdam
projects.description:
During this project I individually conducted a quantitative research on drug smuggling through the port of Rotterdam.
We had to answer our research question through a literature search.

Dit project heb ik af mogen sluiten met een 9,3.

projects.title: Events and safety
projects.description:
During this project we designed a handbook for the Toffler festival in Rotterdam.
I made a 3D drawing about what the terrain looks like and what, for example, the emergency exits were.

I completed this project with a 7.1.

projects.title: Policy note - Robberies in the municipality of Vlaardingen
projects.description:
I have written a policy note for the municipality of Vlaardingen on how they can counter robberies in their municipality.

I was able to finish this project with a 7.1.

projects.title: Auditorium of the future - Prinsentuin College
projects.description:
For my 3rd and final internship I designed the auditorium of the future for the Prinsentuin College, part of ROC West-Brabant.
It provides a context-rich, educational and sustainable environment for students and teachers.

contributors.headline: Mobiliteit | Bereikbaarheid | Gastvrijheid | Facility | Management | Projecten | Coaching | Mensen die mij kennen omschrijven mij als een enthousiaste, gedreven en warme persoonlijkheid.

projects.title: Evacuation plan new building Vitalis College
projects.description: With this project we have set up an evacuation plan for a new building of the Vitalis College. In this we have seen various evacuation plans and we describe the emergency response organization and escape routes.

volunteer_experiences.description: As a Citizen Emergency Responder, I commit myself to a safer community by being standby 24/7 for situations where a person is in need of CPR.
